articles.title: European Space Agency satellite close to reentering Earth's atmosphere • RFI English - RFI English
articles.description: The European Space Agency’s ERS-2 (European Remote Sensing 2) satellite will reenter the Earth’s atmosphere and burn up later today, Wednesday. 🔔 Subscribe ...

articles.author: Jeff Foust
articles.title: Impending European satellite reentry highlights debris mitigation challenges - SpaceNews
articles.description: The impending reentry of a European satellite serves as a reminder of the hazards posed by existing objects as agencies work to mitigate debris.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON The impending reentry of a defunct European satellite serves as a reminder of the hazards posed by existing objects even as agencies work to mitigate the growth of orbital debris.
The Eur… [+3691 chars]

articles.author: Mikayla Mace Kelley
articles.title: 'The future is fungal': New research finds that fungi that live in healthy plants are sensitive to climate change - Phys.org
articles.description: Spruce, pine, fir and other trees tower across the frigid swaths of land that span North America, northern Europe and Russia in a great ring around the world. These boreal forests constitute the largest land ecosystem and the northernmost forests on Earth.
